abstract: Work on the Mod O solar Brayton engine/alternator set is redirected to utilize solarized components of the automotive advanced gas turbine (AGT). The new configuration is referred to as the Mod I. Commercialization of solar Brayton engines thus should be enhanced not only by relating the design to an engine expected to reach the high quantity, low cost production rates associated with the automotive market, but also by the potential the AGT components provide for growth of efficiency and power rating. This growth would be achieved through use of ceramics in later versions making operation possible at temperatures up to 2500 F. The longer program duration and higher cost of the Mod I is considered.
title: Solar Brayton engine/alternator set

publications.publicationName: JPL  Parabolic Dish Solar Thermal Power Ann. Program Rev. Proc.

related.title: Parabolic Dish Solar Thermal Power Annual Program Review Proceedings
